data.author: jelavice
data.message:
Merge branch 'anymal_research/rsl/feature/grid_map_vis' into 'master'

Rsl/feature/grid map vis

This feature allows you to change the resolution of the mesh lines in the grid map as well as to change their thickness. When displaying large maps, the large number of mesh lines can cause the rviz to crash. With this feature you can lower their resolution, thus reducing their number. In addition you can also change the thickness of the grid lines.

The resolution of the mesh remains unaffected.

Below are two examples, the first one with full resolution and thin grid lines, the second one with the grid line resolution reduced by a factor of 4 and grid line thickness increased by a factor of 4.

![rviz_screenshot_2021_08_23-09_29_58](/uploads/48302bed69840b49e740f9a2a072a31d/rviz_screenshot_2021_08_23-09_29_58.png)

![rviz_screenshot_2021_08_23-09_29_36](/uploads/7ac15bf0d2fde938c1d28bc80e623b31/rviz_screenshot_2021_08_23-09_29_36.png)

Import change set of branch rsl/feature/grid_map_vis.

--
Change 1 of 9 by Magnus Gaertner <mgaertner@anybotics.com>:

fixed formatting, a typo and added a check so that rviz does not crash if the user adds an infeasible value for the decimation factor.

--

Fix bug

Add the thickness and decimation property

data.message:
Merge branch 'anymal_research/rsl/feature/cubic_interp' into 'master'

Rsl/feature/cubic interp

Added bicubic and bicubic-convolution interpolation algorithm.  Bicubic interpolation is more accurate but it is also more expensive to compute and it requires derivatives to be estimated. Bicubic convolution is computationally more lightweight but it is less accurate and it does not guarantee continuous first derivatives.

Squashed commit:

Import change set of branch rsl/feature/cubic_interp.

data.author: rgrandia
data.message:
Merge branch 'anymal_research/rsl/feature/refactor_normalfilter' into 'master'

[grid_map] refactor normal filter.

- Implemented Covariance matrix with a recursive formula to prevent copying all the points.
- Use different eigen decomposition which is specialized for the symmetric case and has a closed for solution for Matrix3d
- Remove rank check -> eigen decomposition is rank revealing https://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox/group__TopicLinearAlgebraDecompositions.html
- Filter now handles the case of perfect planar data.
- Remaining degenerate cases are: 1) less than 3 datapoints available 2) all data is on a single line.

Together with the other PRs of today the normal filter runs 2-3x faster for my test case.

@perception/localization-and-mapping

data.message:
Merge branch 'anymal_research/rsl/fix/line_iterator' into 'master'

rsl/fix/line_iterator

The line iterator my not be initialized after construction. This can lead to segfault when using the iterator later on.

Here an example I cached:

startPos = [1.96 0.170931];
endPos = [0.01, -0.0190691]
Grid size = [91 x 91]
Grid resolution: 0.02

The output from gdb:

GITLAB_ISSUE_0  0x00007fffca27123b in **grid_map::GridMap::at**(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, Eigen::Array<int, 2, 1, 0, 2, 1> const&) const ()
   from /home/fabianje/catkin_ws/devel/lib/libgrid_map_core.so

GITLAB_ISSUE_1  0x00007fffca271372 in grid_map::GridMap::isValid(Eigen::Array<int, 2, 1, 0, 2, 1> const&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&) const ()
   from /home/fabianje/catkin_ws/devel/lib/libgrid_map_core.so

GITLAB_ISSUE_2  ...

This MR does not fix the issue, but at least let people know what is going wrong.

@perception
@motion-control (for those who use grid map)

data.author: fabianje
data.message:
Merge branch 'anymal_research/rsl/feature/perceptive_contact_detection' into 'master'

Rsl/feature/perceptive contact detection

This MR embeds the elevation map into the state estimator and the contact detector. The changes include:

Probabilistic Contact Detection (@perception/state-estimation, @motion-control, @markusta FYI):
*  A new state, called `StateElevationMap` is added that derives from the class `State`. It overloads some functions related to terrain perception.
*  A grid map can be passed to that class using the function setSubMap(...).

State Estimator (@perception/state-estimation, @trfabian FYI):
*  By default, the state estimator will not subscribe to the elevation map.
*  If enabled, the state estimator will subscribe to the topic `/elevation_map_processing/sub_map` (the topic can be changed in the parameter file).
*  The corresponding sub map is published within the package `elevation_map_processing` (originally written by @avijayan). This node can be launched with `roslaunch elevation_map_processing elevation_map_processing.launch`. Post processing of the elevation map is necessary as some part of the grid map may not contain data (e.g. spots that are not in the viewpoint of the realsense. This is particularly limiting when walking downstairs as the terrain behind the edge of the stairs is not directly observable).
*  The State of the contact detector is no more created within the contact detector class, but within the state estimator. If perception is disabled, the state will be constructed as `State` (same as before), and otherwise as `StateElevationMap`.

Grid Map (@perception, @perception/state-estimation FYI):
*  The function `fromMessage`is now overloaded. The overloaded function allows to specify certain layers that should be copied (instead of copying all layers that that may only be interesting for control).

Some notes:
*  The processed elevation map is now used in both, the controller and the state estimator. A later MR will move the package `elevation_map_processing` to a better location (at the moment it is in motion_generation repo). Any suggestions for this?
*  There is an offset between the estimated contact location of the feet and the elevation map. For this, a parameter called `foot_center_over_elevation_map` was added that corrects for the mismatch. As we have the exact same issue on the locomotion side, a later MR will move the estimated contact location down to the actual contact surface.
*  This MR and another pending[one](https://code.anymal.com/anymal-research/anymal_research/merge_requests/86) introduce man parameters associated to the probabilistic contact detector. A later MR will put all parameters into a struct to improve readability.

data.author: jelavice
data.message:
Merge branch 'anymal_research/rsl/feature/map_from_raw_pointcloud' into 'master'

Rsl/feature/map from raw pointcloud

Piece of code that will generate an elevation map from a raw pointcloud.

To reproduce the results you can download the pointclouds from here:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1TxIN6Ox3JybccqpbKr6KhatylUNDPbRK?usp=sharing

There is a pointcloud from Hoenggerberg field, forest patch and the H floor in LEE building.

To run the node, create a data folder inside the package:
grid_map_pcl/data

copy the pointcloud files into the "data" folder. Change the name in the launch file (the only launch file) and run. Piontclouds are big, so it takes about 5-10 min to get the final result. Once the computation has finished (you will see the total time elapsed), you can run the rviz in another terminal to visualize the map.

You can see an example elevation map of a forest, created from raw pointcloud in the images attached.

![forest_pointcloud](/uploads/2fcd70d0b120b1d414ef8bae26ecef8e/forest_pointcloud.png)![forest](/uploads/5e2c71ddd79968b7c5f6f770f3557a01/forest.png)

* It adds methods the conversion table type to do so
* Those methods are unit tested
* Change the unit tests to typed unit tests in order to test multiple different conversion tables
* Introduce a test fixture with common test code
* Small reformatting changes

data.author: Dominic Jud
data.message:
Merge branch 'anymal_research/feature/clear_sub_map' into 'master'

Feature/clear sub map

I implemented a SetGridMap service in elevation_mapping to change/process the elevation map from the outside, such that one can feed additional information into elevation mapping (e.g. initializing the elevation map with a ground plane) The changes in grid_map only contain the service definition. The provided map in SetGridMap does not need to be the same resolution, size or position, because the indices are matched through positions. Also, a mask can be, but does not have to be, set for only changing a certain part of the map.

data.author: 2scholz
data.message:
SpiralIterator fix for center out of bounds

In case the center of the SprialIterator was chosen to be outside of the map
a segmentation fault was thrown when trying to use the iterator.

One reason was, that the index of the center was not computed correctly,
because the getIndexFromPosition returned false without changing
the value for the index. Now the index is computed, but the function still
returns false in case the position is not inside the map.

The other reason for this was that only the cells next to the center were
looked at in that case. When these cells also were outside of the map, then
dereferencing the pointer lead to a segmentation fault. This was fixed by
generating rings until a position that is inside the map was reached.

data.author: 2scholz
data.message:
SpiralIterator Test, for center out of bounds

The test was created because initializing a SpiralIterator with a center that is
outside of the map was leading to a segmentation fault when accessing the iterator.

The test creates a SpiralIterator with a center that is outside of the map with
a radius chosen, so that the iterator will reach the map.
Then the created iterator is used to get the corresponding position on the map
and it is verified that the returned position is actually inside the map.
